text: employee was tested with covid'19 positive employee was tested with covid'19 positive and under home quarantine as per medical advice. employee was tested with covid'19 positive and under home quarantine as per medical advice.

category: bites (animals or insects), general illness or health issue
text: commissioning technician was pulling t-posts near pcs-14 when they were stung by a wasp on their left gloved pinky.  on 06.02.2021 at approximately 13:45, a commissioning technician was tasked to pull t-posted from the ground near pcs-14. the technician noticed a wasp that was in the work area although lost sight of the insect after some time. as the technician went to pull a t-post, a wasp stung their left gloved pinky. the actual severity rating is a b1 as first aid, as sting relief and hydrocortisone ointment were provided. the potential severity rating is a b2 as there could have been medical treatment had the technician had an allergic reaction to the sting. the technician informed their supervisor, who escorted them to the on-site medic. first-aid was administered in the form of sting-relief topical and hydrocortisone ointment was applied. the employers workcare was notified.  no follow-up was needed, and self-care was sufficient. investigation protocols were initiated.
one wood employee tested positive for covid-19 one wood employee tested positive for covid-19 on the hibernia platform.  employee is self isolating.

category: vehicle incident general, vehicle Incident involving animal
text: wood vehicle sruck a cow on the road.  on august 24, 2020 at 10:55 pm, a wood ee was traveling to his next location on hwy 652 near orla, tx when his vehicle struck a cow on the road. the impact from the incident caused damage to the passenger side front end and side door on the wood vehicle. actual (b1): no injuries, unsure of damage cost. potential (b2): damage to the vehicle could be over 10k, but will not exceed 100k. wood ee notified his client supervisor and wood account manager of the incident.

wood vehicle came into contact with another vehicle when exiting a parking bay. wood operative when pulling out of a parking bay outside of the central workshop on site was interrupted by a hertel van commencing a reverse parking manoeuvre into the bay next to him. the wood driver waited for the vehicle in the next parking bay to stop and then started to pull forward. as he did pull away the passenger in the front seat of the stationary van opened their door and it came into contact with a hinge on the drop side the wood van resulting in a peeling effect to the hertel van door.   our driver self presented at security / tfs for d&a testing.

amecfw employee slipped on office staircase while walking down the office staircase an amecfw employee misplaced their foot and their heel slipped off the edge of the tread. the individual was holding the handrail during the decent, however let go when slipping downwards.  the individual slipped onto their bottom and bumped down the remaining 6 stair treads. the individual involved did not require any first aid treatment.  individual reported the slip to the office management (hertel), their amecfw line manager and the hsse advisor. the stair treads were inspected and appear to be in good condition. the individual’s footwear also appears to be in sound condition.

employee communicated a positive confirmation for covid-19  an employee reported a confirmed positive test for covid-19 to site management. the employee has been in isolation. wood is identifying those who may have worked in proximity.  appropriate notifications have been completed. this is first of two positive results for 10th of july.

a wood employee tested positive for covid-19. a wood employee received a positive covid-19 test result on 10/16/2021.  the wood employee was experiencing symptoms and scheduled a covid 19 test which was a positive result.  contact tracing has been completed. employee has self quarantined and has notified management.  wood on site management has conducted contact tracing and notification to client.

trebel 10 -test machine not in control when a servo electric test machine - trebel 10, was turned back on it started applying load upto approx. 2 tonnes, when it shouldn't have done. the emergency stop was hit. when the machine was re-set to load at 0.1 tonne it continued to apply 2 tonnes. it was fully shutdown and restarted and again did the same. random pushing of the buttons caused the machine to stop. this was alerted to hsse by heart - first thing on 01/02 hsse manager conducted immediate investigation with lab owner and technical experts.  fault could not be replicated exactly but a fault condition was ascertained so immediate action has been set up to instigate a technical investigation.  until the fault is ascertained then all similar test machines are off line - this has been communicated to all relevant staff members.

acute back pain experienced when egressing from scaffold worksite ip was destructing scaffold platform on qu cellar deck, due to access restrictions he had to crawl on his stomach under some cable tray, when he was 'backing out' from under tray he felt discomfort in his lower back, ip exited worksite and reported to floatel medic for assistance. ip was treated with prescription strength medication) ip reported to medic

cp-2022-0028 fa scott steel; abrasion left index finger from zoomboom door ip was closing the top half of zoom boom door when ip placed hand in between top & bottom half. this caused ip’s left index finger to become pinched resulting in an abrasion. work stopped and supervisor was contacted. ip was taken to onsite pa who assessed, cleaned, bandaged, and gave otc’s. ip returned to work. incident investigation initiated.

category: bites (animals or insects), general illness or health issue, general injury
text: flagger received a bee sting on the back of the neck.  on october 23rd, 2020 at approximately at 3:30 est, an employee was flagging on the main road by pcs-11 when they felt a sting on the back of the neck. the employee notified their general foreman who brought the employee to the safety office to see the on-site medic for evaluation. the actual is a b1 as first aid treatment (benadryl and cortisone) were provided.  the potential is a b1 as no potential of a medical treatment would have been needed. medic removed the stinger and the employee was monitored. the employee showed no signs of an allergic reaction and was released by the medic to return to full work duty.

staple penetrated 110v cable a series of 110v cables had been installed for lighting of the redundant fabrication workshop which had been build approx. 10 months previously. temporary lighting electrical technicians were removing/re-routing tl cabling from the area. on moving a 110v cable, an arc flash was observed when the cable touched a scaffold tube, where cable had previously been stapled to a wooden scaffold board. the electrical technician was holding the cable approximately 30cm away from arc flash and immediately stepped back.closer inspection observed a staple penetrating the cable stopped job

pig launcher tray supplied by third party found to have small deposits of norm contaminated material  to facilitate removal of an intelligent pig from the cats pig receiver, a pig launcher tray was supplied to site by a third party vendor (pii). prior to the removal of the pig a small amount of brown material was observed on the tray prior to use. due to the likelihood of naturally occurring radioactive material (norm) contamination being expected on the pig following removal, the cats rps was already present at the job site and tested the material for the presence of norm. readings in the range of 9 to 12 counts above background radiation levels were recorded indicating the material on the tray was norm contaminated. the material was safely removed from the tray and disposed of in line with the cats norm procedures utilising an approved cleaning contractor. a follow up investigation will be required to determine why pii allowed the contaminated tray to be delivered to cats.  the appropriate controls were implemented for the handling of the contaminated waste.

ip struck hand against a sharp edge (note: incident reported by jim mawson, who is not currently accessible in the system address book.)site maintenance removed an old laptop cable lock from a desk using cutters. this left the cut end with a sharp edge / burr and was lodged in the cable tidy slot at the back of the desk.  while attempting to push the cable through the slot, the ip cut her right index finger. first aid requested and sticking plaster applied, (after checking she was not allergic).  the cable had been removed by fm before the first aider arrived.

individual tested positive for covid during pre mobalisation test the individual was mobilised to hallmark hotel for isolation and covid-19 testing (pcr) prior to mobilising offshore. on the 21/02/2021 the ip received results stating it was positive for covid-19. the ip is a kaefer employee. the ip was not displaying any signs or symptoms of covid-19. individual is self isolating at home

wood employee incurred a flat tire on his way home after work.  the front right tire separated and damaged the fender and inner liner.  no injuries. migrated from legacy cairs incident #38516wood employee was on his way home after work traveling west on interstate 90 going 75 to 80mph (the posted speed limit is 80). he encountered debris on the highway from another tire failure and after he went through it, he incurred a flat tire. he pulled over to the emergency lane and changed the tire. the right front fender and inner liner were damaged. he did not see what he drove over. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

category: vehicle incident general, lifting or moving loads
text: a wood f-450 truck made contact with the back bumper of the wood heavey civil truck. on 10/17/2020, at approximately 5:30 pm, personnel were returning from the field when drivers from a dodge ram 2500 and a ford f-450 pulled over to the side of the road to allow 2 dump trucks to pass.  the dodge ram was position in front of the f-450 when the vehicles had stopped.  the driver of the f-450 proceeded to move forward, after allowing the dump trucks to pass, striking and damaging the parked dodge ram's rear bumper. damage was also sustained to the f-450’s front bumper. the actual severity rating of this incident is a c1 as the damage is less than $10k.  the potential severity rating was classified as a c2 due to the potential that medical treatment could have been sustained to either driver from the impact of the two vehicles. the driver of the ford f-450 pulled his vehicle over to remove it from the middle of the road.  the scene was then frozen.  the incident was reported to senior management. incident investigation protocols were initiated. no injuries were sustained to personnel.

category: site compliance or practice issue, hand or arm injury, lifting or moving loads
text: i&e technician was struck lightly on the forearm with a winch handle while manoeuvring a filtrax unit - no injury i&e technician was struck on the forearm with a winch handle while maneuvering a filtrax unit.the filtrax unit is used for analysing chlorine levels and is required to be raised from and lowered into the tank.a fixed winch and davit arm is used to manouver the filtrax unit.  the winch is ratcheted for raising however for lowering the unit the winch is required to be running free, whilst the tech guides the unit down.  it was whilst the unit was being lowered that the tech was struck on the forearm by the free running winch handle. no injury occurred as the contact was only very light.the winch has since been tagged out of service until the winch is replaced with a device that is ratcheted in both directions. the winch has since been tagged out of service until the winch is replaced with a device that is ratcheted in both directions.

theft of property migrated from legacy cairs incident #30763on 5 july, 2016 around 0700, equipment manager and job foreman notifiedsafetythat over the weekend of 2-4 july, job number 05-ana-16026, located (40.11782806370418, -104.8632060271733) near fort lupton colorado, company jobtrailer was broke into and several tools and equipment was taken (photo listincluded of what was taken). weld county sheriff department was notified by equipment manager and job site supervisor,report made. weld county sheriff deputy responded to call. assignedcase number is 16w02405. after our initial inspection, we noticed that the lock was gone that was cut off the trailer.deputy said there was a string of this going on to these trailer. "they grind off the locks and take them with them".deputy told us to contact him if anything else is missing. witness statement and photos included in report migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

category: general injury, hand or arm injury
text: non work related. ip fell from his push bike outside punta europa sustaining a broken rib, lacerations and bruises. migrated from legacy cairs incident #3659308-mar-201821:50 received a call from the pe clinic doctor regarding one of our employees that was being evaluated at the on-site clinic. at appx. 20:00ip had been riding his push bike outside of the complete (roundabout south of malabo dos), whenthey had lost control of the bike and made contact with theground. the local x-ray revealedip had fractured a rib along with some cuts and bruises. since they could not determine if the ip had sustained any internal injuries they were planning to transfer him to local hospital (la paz) for further evaluation. 22:15 cmo and paramedic transported the ip via ambulance and ip was admitted tola paz.09-mar-201808:30 hexagon pm traveled to local hospital to check on ip. la paz medical staff conducted another x-ray and ultrasound to try to determine the extent of the injury to ip. since the mri was not functioning at the time of admittance, ip was moved for scan at 0945. local pe medical staff will visit ip at 1400 to check on ip anddiscuss with local medical staff at la paz. early indication from pe clinic medical staff is ip will need t travel to hor for recovery and will not be deemed fit for work. 05-april-2018the below update was sent to houston hr from the ip who is now at home:ip had an x-ray conducted on 29-march-2018 which concluded the ip's ribs are knitting back together very well.ip has an appointment booked with the fracture clinic for their shoulder on 13-april-2018.ip is wearing an arm support which is helping with the shoulder injury.more information will be available after the appointment on 13-april-2018 regarding further time frame for healing and when ip will likely be ready to return to work.16-april-2018hexagon pm made contact via email with the ip, the following update was provided:ip is now waiting for a ct scan appointment, hopefully it will be before w/e 22nd april.ip is felling much better and recovery is going well.23 april 2018the following update was sent to the hexagon pm from the ip:ip travelled to france to visit a private clinic where a ct scan was conducted and an appointment with the specialist.ip should know within a few days how far from fully recovered they are and when they can return to work. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

category: general injury, slips & trips, foot or leg injury
text: ie received a minor skin abrasion to their right knee after slipping on some gravel. ie was entering the jobsite from the contractors gate. while crossing the street ie slipped on some gravel on the road that was tracked from the turnstile area.  ie reported to safety department, received first aid. all designated walkways have been cleared of gravel. additional lighting is scheduled to be installed for all designated walkways.

wood employee tested positive for covid-19 wood employee tested positive for covid-19, via 2 x lfdt's. this is understood to be a community transmission. employee entered self-isolation period as per government requirements.

single vehicle incident employee lost control of vehicle due to snow and icy conditions.  vehicle crossed the other lane of traffic and drove through the wire guard rail. the local police were contacted and the vehicle was towed.

pmc qc inspector expeienced loss of consciousness in the office pmc qc inspector returned to his desk after site visit. the individual then stood up from his desk and felt faint and went to site down in his chair. after sitting in his chair, the individual experienced a loss of consciousness for a period of 1-2 minutes and slumped to the ground. a colleague of the individual's assisted him and escorted him the site clinic where his vital signs were checked (normal). following this, the individual was escorted to the local hospital where an ecg and blood tests were taken (normal). the individual was escorted home and regular contact was made with him during the evening. the individual returned to work on the morning of the 29th may 2018 and advice was given to him to undertake a full medical by the pmc hses director, purely as a precautionary measure to which the individual agreed. individual accompanied to site clinic for initial assessment.individual accompanied to local hospital for further assessment.pmc hses director and pmc administration manager notified.

category: hand or arm injury, foot or leg injury
text: ee cut his finger with a grinder while adjusting the guard. ee did not unplug the grinder prior to making the adjustment. migrated from legacy cairs incident #28817on tuesday, february 16, 2016 at 11:30 am an infinity construction ee cut his finger with a grinder while adjusting the guard.ee did not unplug the grinder prior to making the adjustment. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

category: slips & trips, foot or leg injury
text: a massy wood employee was pulling a 1/4" plate off a cutting table which inadvertently fell and came in contact with his safety boot. a massy wood employee was pulling a 1/4" x 12'' x 12'' carbon steel plate off a cutting table; the plate slipped and came in contact with the mid area of his right side safety steel toe boot. the boot was damage as a result of the impact. there were no injuries sustained by the employee and no evidence to suggest injury could have occurred to more than one (1) employee and no more than a medical treatment case. incident was reported. an assessment was performed by the site first aider and there were no injuries sustained.the employee resume normal duties.

unauthorised access and threatening behaviour towards site access control guards by unknown vehicle mounted armed intruders  report received from epc 55b-fdhjv, security manager that unauthorised access and threatening behaviour towards site access guards at gate 7 by unknown armed intruders travelling in two black vehicles (suv and sedan). amecfw  project engineer security (pmc security)  made call to g4s guard supervisor afsal, informing him of incident, followed by instruction to close gate 8 (g4s controlled) and for guards to move into cabin until further notice for reasons of safety.all epcs, via security managers, were advised to close all perimeter access gates and for workforce tomove into offices. call made to senior knpc engineer waleed al kandari at 07:30 requesting assistance from ministry of interior (police) but advised by engineer waleed for pmc to deal directly with police, this  differed from previous instructions from knpc.   pmc were informed of a potential second weapon being seen by fdh, and that the first vehicle that threatened the guards had left site through the same gate 7. pmc security called the emergency services (112) requesting police assistance with potential weapons involved.  pmc security and epc 55b construction manager independently  visited the now locked, gate 6 by 07:45.  (where fdh security manager last reported a sighting of the vehicle with armed intruders).location coordinates were subsequently sent to moi-police who arrived within a 10 minute period. fdh security manager arrived at approximately 08.15 and provided transportation for the moi personnel across site (police traffic saloon vehicle, unsuitable for terrain). tshj security manager with pmc security subsequently visited all the site perimeter gates to confirmed they were secure and the guards understood issued instructions. gate 2, under lngi (hss not part of nrp), were unaware of the situation, but informed to secure their gate. tshj & pmc security drove directly to gate 8 due to build-up of traffic. at 10:28 the moi left the site after an exhaustive checks. all gates were instructed to reopen and to monitor for the unauthorised vehicles, with instructions to report but not approach if seen. single suspect vehicle returned through fdh area (gate 7) area, moi summoned and site immediately locked down. vehicle occupants were taken into custody at 15:01. site was reopened. police reported that invaders were  bedoon (nationless people) out shooting pigeons. amec foster wheeler still awaiting on investigation report from contractor (fdh). all perimeter gates closed and guards and employees withdraw into buildings. ministry of interior-police, notified and requested to provide assistance.

forklift outrigger function did not stop once engaged, causing load to contact windshield and crack it.		 forklift operator was booming out a 23' piece of pipe in the new fuel oil tank area to set it in the trench. the pipe did have a tag line and a spotter.  when the operator set the out rigger down, the control malfunctioned which caused the outrigger to continue downward and made the pipe to swing into the windshield cracking it.  the spotter was unable to control the load with the tag line long enough to prevent the pipe from making contact. operator called his supervisor and then supervisor notified wood safety.  the malfunction of the outrigger control was witnessed in a secure area and the forklift was tagged out for repairs. all work discontinued until a new forklift could be delivered.

category: head or face injury, general injury, hand or arm injury, slips & trips
text: fall on same level due to tripping on uneven surface an employee tripped on an uneven sidewalk and fell to the ground, suffering a broken left wrist, a broken neck vertebra, and a laceration to the left temple.

text: pedestrian struck by vehicle in nonroadway area, unspecified an employee was struck by a forklift while unloading material.

other fall to lower level less than 6 feet an employee was stepping down from a three-step top stock cart and missed the last step, falling to the floor. she was hospitalized with a fractured left hip.
caught in running equipment or machinery during regular operation a shear machine amputated an employee's right middle fingertip (with no bone loss).
other fall to lower level, unspecified a worker slipped and fell while wearing stilts, resulting in a fractured hip that required hospitalization.

category: slips & trips, foot or leg injury
text: fall on same level, n.e.c.  an employee as investigating a leak at roof level beside a parts rack at the final assembly area. as the employee was taking a picture of the leak, he stepped back into the drive path of a dolly train. the employee made contact with the third dolly in the train causing the employee to fall to the ground and fracture a leg.

category: vehicle incident general, dropped object or material, foot or leg injury
text: struck or run over by rolling powered vehicle an employee was operating a pickup truck to deliver a special events trailer to a ball field. the employee dropped the trailer off and exited the pickup truck. the unmanned vehicle began to roll and the employee attempted to stop the rolling pickup truck. the employee's right leg was struck by the vehicle. the employee sustained crushing injuries and was hospitalized for surgery.

category: head or face injury, slips & trips
text: other fall to lower level less than 6 feet an employee descending a staircase tripped and fell approximately 5 steps, landing on her left side and suffering a head injury and fractures.

category: fall from or working at height issue, general injury
text: other fall to lower level 6 to 10 feet an employee was working from an 8 foot ladder to hang an air hose reel weighing 44 pounds. as the employee was trying to lift up the hose reel, he lost his balance and fell hitting his midsection on the metal lathe chip guard.
overexertion involving outside sources, unspecified an employee was delivering a 320-pound door when he strained his back, requiring hospitalization.

ignition of vapors, gases, or liquids an employee was clearing the pump to get the turbine ready for maintenance. while flushing the heavy coker gas oil (hcgo) pump, some hcgo got reintroduced into the pipe. when the hot oil (700 degrees) touched the water in the sewer drain, it flashed back and burned the employee. the employee suffered second degree burns to the abdomen and third degree burns to both hands and knees.

category: slips & trips, foot or leg injury
text: other fall to lower level less than 6 feet an employee was removing a tarp covering a mechanical fabrication area. the employee was standing on the fourth rung of an 8-foot ladder when he lost his footing and fell to the ground sustaining a broken tibia/fibula.

compressed or pinched by shifting objects or equipment an employee was trying to free a screw that was clogged with rice hulls. the employee shut off the power to the screw and went to pull on the belt that was connected to the pulley that ran the screw. while the employee was pulling on the belt, the screw became free. the stored energy from the bound screw caused the belt and pulley to rotate while the employee was holding the belt. the employee's left index finger entered the pinch point of the belt and pulley, amputating the left fingertip above the nail cuticle.

struck by or caught in swinging door or gate an employee was leaving a room when the door closed on his left index finger, amputating the fingertip.

struck by dislodged flying object, particle on july 7, 2021, a painter was attempting to remove residual material while using a portable pneumatic powered abrasive wheel. the organic rubber wheel broke apart and debris struck the employee's eye. the employee was hospitalized.
exposure to environmental heat after delivering mail on a walking route in extreme heat, an employee became ill and began throwing up. he was hospitalized for heat stress.

compressed or pinched by shifting objects or equipment an employee was handling a rare-earth magnet. the magnet was attracted to a metal plate, and the employee's fingertip was amputated between the two.

category: vehicle incident general, hand or arm injury, foot or leg injury, head or face injury, fall from or working at height issue
text: pedestrian struck by vehicle in nonroadway area, unspecified an employee was standing on a 12-foot step ladder when a powered industrial truck struck the ladder, causing the employee to fall and hit the floor. the employee received multiple facial, hand, and finger injuries.

compressed or pinched by shifting objects or equipment an employee was connecting two dollies. he had pulled the pin from the eyelet of one dolly and was pulling the other dolly to make a connection when his right middle finger was caught between the tongue of one dolly and the eyelet of the other dolly. the finger was lacerated between the nail and the first knuckle, and the fingertip was medically amputated.

struck by powered vehicle-nontransport, unspecified an employee was unloading a new trackhoe from a tractor trailer. the trackhoe's tracks moved and crushed the employee's hand. the employee's left index finger was amputated.
caught in or compressed by equipment or objects, unspecified an employee was cleaning equipment when his left index finger was caught in the equipment, resulting in a fingertip amputation.

ignition of vapors, gases, or liquids two employees were changing an expansion valve on an outdoor chiller unit. one employee was using a canister torch to sweat the piping and valve while the other was pulling on the pipe with a pair of pliers. when the connection came loose, excess fluid inside of the valve was ignited by the torch and splashed onto the employee with the torch. the employee suffered second-degree burns from the right side of the face down to the right side of the waist.

caught in running equipment or machinery during maintenance, cleaning  on april 23, 2016, at approximately 4:00 pm an employee experienced a crushing injury and fractures when he got his left forearm and wrist caught between rollers while troubleshooting calendar rolls on the extrusion line.  the injury required surgery.

text: fall on same level, n.e.c.  an employee and his driving partner were disconnecting a tanker trailer from their tractor. due to the weather conditions, the release handles on the fifth wheel coupling had ice build-up on them. the employee was disengaging the fifth wheel with a fifth wheel puller when the puller slipped. this caused the employee to lose his balance, falling backward and striking his head on an adjacent trailer. he suffered a head laceration and was hospitalized.

category: slips & trips, foot or leg injury
text: other fall to lower level less than 6 feet an employee was stepping off of the tailgate of a truck when he slipped and fell, breaking his lower tibia.

fall on same level, unspecified an employee fell twice (once at 4:30 a.m., once at 11:30 a.m.). the first fall caused her significant pain; she also suffered a broken right hip, possibly in the second fall.

fall or jump from vehicle in normal operation, nonroadway an employee was unloading a trailer. when he reached the dock plate, the wheels of his pallet jack hit the dock plate and became stuck, causing him to fall off the jack to the concrete floor. he suffered a brain injury.

category: general injury, hand or arm injury
text: caught in running equipment or machinery during maintenance, cleaning  an employee's arm was caught in a hydraulic press while cleaning it resulting in two fractures in the arm and five fractures in the hand. the employee was hospitalized for surgery. the arm was later amputated below the elbow.
other jump to lower level, unspecified an employee jumped out of the tailgate of a work truck, breaking his lower left tibia.

direct exposure to electricity, greater than 220 volts an employee was exposed to and came into contact with approximately 46,000 volts of electrical current from a downed power line, resulting in third degree electrical burns.

category: fall from or working at height issue, head or face injury
text: other fall to lower level, unspecified employee suffered a critical head injury when he fell off an extension ladder while welding at a steel building construction site.

category: head or face injury, slips & trips
text: fall on same level due to tripping over an object  an employee was working on a bridge site when he tripped on angle iron and fell onto rebar. he suffered an injury to the parotid gland on the right side of his face.

caught in running equipment or machinery during regular operation on june 19, 2020, an employee was operating a cutting tool machine when the employee's right thumb was caught and partially amputated in the machine.

overexertion in lifting-single episode an employee was replacing a panel on a machine that weighed approximately 15 pounds. while lifting and adjusting the panel, the employee pulled a muscle in his lower back.

explosion of pressure vessel, piping, or tire an employee was working on a tire while a customer was putting air in an air tank. the tank exploded under pressure, causing injuries to both of the employee's legs.

category: fall from or working at height issue, foot or leg injury
text: other fall to lower level, unspecified an employee fell from a ladder and fractured the tibia.

struck by or caught in swinging door or gate an employee was entering the utility closet when their finger was caught between the door and the door frame resulting in a partial amputation of the right fifth finger.
caught in running equipment or machinery during regular operation a temporary employee's left hand was crushed and lacerated by a shear. the shear was guarded at the time.
